definition: to tread/to stamp/to step on/to press a pedal/to investigate on the spot
to tread/to stamp/to step on/to press a pedal/to investigate on the spot

sentences.english: To think rich oneself have to step to work dependably and on the spot.
sentences.chinese: 要想有钱就得自己踏踏实实地工作，。

sentences.english: Can have two whole days every week to crawl on the checkers without disturbance.
sentences.chinese: 一个礼拜可以有两天时间在家踏踏实实地爬格子。

sentences.english: You'd better stop building castles in the air and get down to some practical work.
sentences.chinese: 你最好不要再作种种空想，该踏踏实实做些事了。

sentences.english: I can have two whole days every week to crawl on the checkers without disturbance.
sentences.chinese: 一个礼拜可以有两天时间在家踏踏实实地爬格子。

sentences.english: The Earth element of Taurus brings strength and his awesome desire for solid ground form and structure.
sentences.chinese: 土相星座的特质让金牛座欲望并具有踏踏实实的能力。

definition: to have one's feet firmly planted on the ground (idiom); realistic without flights of fancy/steady and serious character
one step, one footprint (idiom); steady progress/reliable

definition: firmly-based/steady/steadfast/to have peace of mind/free from anxiety/Taiwan pr. [ta4 shi2]
concentrating one's thoughts and efforts/single-minded/bent on/intently
to follow the prescribed order; to keep to the working routine (idiom)
to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)/to aim too high
to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
(to play) one's part/one's role/one's duty/(to stay within) one's bounds/dutiful/keeping to one's role
